organism_name.title: organism_name
organism_name.description: Name of the expected organism. Should correspond to a NCBI Taxonomy node

infraspecific_name.title: infraspecific_name
infraspecific_name.description: scientific name for any taxon below the rank of species, i.e. an infraspecific taxon or infraspecies.

lineage.title: lineage
lineage.description: The complete taxonomic lineage for the taxonomic node indicated.

assembled_genome_acc.title: assembled_genome_acc
assembled_genome_acc.description: The accession assigned to a genome assembly generated by the FDA Argos Team

genome_assembly_id.title: genome_assembly_id
genome_assembly_id.description: Assembly DB identifier (Example: NCBI assembly accession)

taxonomy_id.title: taxonomy_id
taxonomy_id.description: NCBI taxonomy identifier of the organism.

schema_version.title: schema_version
schema_version.description: Reflective of the Data Dictionary version currently applied to the dataset.

analysis_platform.title: analysis_platform
analysis_platform.description: The platform used to conduct the analysis.

analysis_platform_object_id.title: analysis_platform_object_id
analysis_platform_object_id.description: Unique identifier of archive containing data and analyses. Examples include HIVEPack or Research Object (RO).

assembly_file_source.title: assembly_file_source
assembly_file_source.description: Resource that the fasta files are derived from in the form of a URI/static URL.

genomic_section.title: genomic_section
genomic_section.description: The section of an organisms genome undergoing analysis (i.e. the gene, segment, chromosome, contig, etc.)

num_chromosomes.title: num_chromosomes
num_chromosomes.description: Total number of chromosomes in the genome assembly.

num_of_frameshifts.title: num_of_frameshifts
num_of_frameshifts.description: The number of framshifts identified in a gene. A frameshift mutation in a gene refers to the insertion or deletion of nucleotide bases in numbers that are not multiples of three.

num_of_stop_codons.title: num_of_stop_codons
num_of_stop_codons.description: The number of of stop codons identified in a genome assembly (fasta). A stop codon is a sequence of three nucleotides (a trinucleotide) in DNA or messenger RNA (mRNA) that signals a halt to protein synthesis in the cell.

genome_coverage.title: genome_coverage
genome_coverage.description: The number of nucleotide bases in a sequence that align to a specific locus in a reference genome. Coverage = (read count * read length ) / total genome size.

n50.title: n50
n50.description: Length of the shortest read to minimally represent 50% of the assembly.

n75.title: n75
n75.description: Length of the shortest read to minimally represent 95% of the assembly.

n90.title: n90
n90.description: Length of the shortest read to minimally represent 75% of the assembly.

l50.title: l50
l50.description: Number of reads that minimally represent 50% of the assembly.

l75.title: l75
l75.description: Number of reads that minimally represent 75% of the assembly.

ref_genome_acc.title: ref_genome_acc
ref_genome_acc.description: This accession number is a unique identifier assigned to a record in sequence databases such as RefSeq (NCBI).

query_coverage_against_reference.title: query_coverage_against_reference
query_coverage_against_reference.description: The coverage results for a BLAST alignment of the query assembly aligned to the refseq of that organism, or the percent of the query assembly that overlaps with the reference sequence.

reference_coverage_against_query.title: reference_coverage_against_query
reference_coverage_against_query.description: The coverage results of a BLAST search for the refseq for that organism against the assembly being QC'd, or the percent of the reference sequence that overlaps with the query assembly.

percent_identity_against_reference.title: percent_identity_against_reference
percent_identity_against_reference.description: A percentage amount of the query assembly sequence that matched with the reference sequence, or the extent to which the query and reference have the same residues at the same positions when aligned.

percent_reads_unaligned.title: reads_unaligned
percent_reads_unaligned.description: the number of reads that did not align to the reference as a percentage.

assembly_type.title: assembly_type
assembly_type.description: haploid, haploid-with-alt-loci (a haploid assembly with alternative loci, for example as provided by the Genome Reference Consortium for the human genome), diploid, unresolved diploid, or alternate pseudohaplotype. See the NCBI Assembly Data Model for a definition of these terms.

assembly_level.title: assembly_level
assembly_level.description: The highest level of assembly for any object in the assembly.

assembly_score.title: assembly_score
assembly_score.description: Internally developed scores used to evaluate the quality and / or quantity of the information present for a particular entry. Scoring criteria may vary per core data set
